findings.title: Flashloan Attack
findings.description: When working with exchange rates, they should be received from a trusted source and not be vulnerable to short-term rate changes that can be achieved by using flash loans. Oracles should be used.

findings.title: Token Supply Manipulation
findings.description: Tokens can be minted only according to rules specified in a whitepaper or any other documentation provided by the customer.

findings.title: Gas Limit and Loops
findings.description: Transaction execution costs should not depend dramatically on the amount of data stored on the contract. There should not be any cases when execution fails due to the block Gas limit.

findings.title: Style Guide Violation
findings.description: Functions and state variables visibility should be set explicitly. Visibility levels should be specified consciously.

findings.title: Requirements Compliance
findings.description: The code should be compliant with the requirements provided by the Customer.

findings.title: Environment Consistency
findings.description: The project should contain a configured development environment with a comprehensive description of how to compile, build and deploy the code.

findings.title: Secure Oracles Usage
findings.description: The code should have the ability to pause specific data feeds that it relies on. This should be done to protect a contract from compromised oracles.

findings.title: Tests Coverage
findings.description: Deployment and basic user interactions are not covered with tests. Negative case coverage is missing. Interactions with several users are not tested.

findings.title: Functional requirements are partially missing
findings.description: The functional requirements of the smart contract are incomplete.

findings.title: Superficial functional description is provided
findings.description: The documentation lacks a thorough explanation of the contract's functionality.

findings.title: Superficial technical description is provided
findings.description: The technical description of the smart contract is incomplete or lacks sufficient detail.

findings.title: The development environment is not configured.
findings.description: The development environment lacks proper configuration.

findings.title: Code is not covered with comments.
findings.description: The code lacks sufficient comments to explain its functionality and logic.

findings.title: Clippy errors are partially not fixed
findings.description: Some Clippy errors were not fully addressed.

findings.title: Deployment and Basic User Interactions Are Not Covered with Tests
findings.description: The project lacks tests for deployment and basic user interactions, which can lead to potential issues being overlooked.

findings.title: Negative case coverage is missing.
findings.description: Test cases do not cover negative scenarios, which may lead to unforeseen behavior or errors.

findings.title: Interactions with several users are not tested.
findings.description: The contract does not test interactions with multiple users, which can lead to unforeseen behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.
